Packet sniffing tools like Wireshark can capture unencrypted traffic on a network.


Public Wi-Fi networks are particularly vulnerable, as attackers can monitor traffic flowing through the same router.


Unsecured protocols (like HTTP, FTP, or Telnet) send data in plaintext, including potentially sensitive information like passwords.


How to Protect Against It
Always use HTTPS instead of HTTP.


Use a VPN on public networks to encrypt all your internet traffic.


Implement HSTS (HTTP Strict Transport Security) on your websites.


Use secure versions of protocols (e.g., SSH instead of Telnet, SFTP instead of FTP).


Regularly update and patch software and firmware.
